alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Robertson; Sumner; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 11:20AM CST until March 03 at 11:45AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Southwestern Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... North central Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Cheatham County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Robertson County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 1145 AM CST. * At 1119 AM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bellevue, or 10 miles southwest of Nashville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Springfield, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Goodlettsville, White House, Millersville, Greenbrier, Forest Hills, Coopertown, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Ridgetop, Bellevue, Joelton, Bells Bend, Whites Creek and Natchez Trace At Highway 96. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 188 and 210. Interstate 65 between mile markers 82 and 108. Interstate 24 between mile markers 30 and 49. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for Middle Tennessee.
